data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word وَقَالُوا comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word رَبَّنَا comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: to obey, permit/consent, obedience, to do voluntarily, do an act with effort. istaa'a - to be able, have power, be capable of.
data.sentence: The word أَطَعْنَا comes from the root ط و ع and is associated with the meanings: to obey, permit/consent, obedience, to do voluntarily, do an act with effort. istaa'a - to be able, have power, be capable of.

data.meanings: to be lord/noble/glorious, rule/lead, overcome in glory. sawida - to be black, bold. iswadda - to beget a black boy, boy who is chief. swad - great number. al-siyyidda - blessed lady. aswad - black, greater. aswadda wajhuhu - his face became expressive of grief or sorrow. He became sorrowful/confounded/disgraced. It is a token of bad conclusion and failure and sorrow.
data.sentence: The word سَادَتَنَا comes from the root س و د and is associated with the meanings: to be lord/noble/glorious, rule/lead, overcome in glory. sawida - to be black, bold. iswadda - to beget a black boy, boy who is chief. swad - great number. al-siyyidda - blessed lady. aswad - black, greater. aswadda wajhuhu - his face became expressive of grief or sorrow. He became sorrowful/confounded/disgraced. It is a token of bad conclusion and failure and sorrow.

data.meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).
data.sentence: The word وَكُبَرَاءَنَا comes from the root ك ب ر and is associated with the meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).

data.meanings: Erred, strayed, or went astray. Deviated from the right way or course. Missed or lost the right way. Lost something but does not know its place. Confounded or perplexed and unable to see the right course.Become hidden, unperceived, concealed, absent, or escaped. Went away.A lost state. A state of perishing, coming to naught, or passing away.Confusion, perplexity, and inability to see the right course.Skill in guiding, or directing aright, in journeying.One with whom is no good.Water running beneath a rock, or among trees, which the sun does not reach.Ragged land or ground, a hard and stony place.
data.sentence: The word فَأَضَلُّونَا comes from the root ض ل ل and is associated with the meanings: Erred, strayed, or went astray. Deviated from the right way or course. Missed or lost the right way. Lost something but does not know its place. Confounded or perplexed and unable to see the right course.Become hidden, unperceived, concealed, absent, or escaped. Went away.A lost state. A state of perishing, coming to naught, or passing away.Confusion, perplexity, and inability to see the right course.Skill in guiding, or directing aright, in journeying.One with whom is no good.Water running beneath a rock, or among trees, which the sun does not reach.Ragged land or ground, a hard and stony place.

data.meanings: cause, reason, way/path/road, necessity, means of access, responsibility, method/manner, plea to allege.. fi sabil Allah - in the way of Allah, in the cause of Allah, to carry the message of Allah.. ibn al-sabil - traveller, way farer, forlorn traveller.. salsabil - It is made up of two words: sal (ask, enquire about) & sabil (way), salsala - easy, sweet, rapid flowing water. As if it meant 'Inquiring ask your Lord the way to that sweet, easy palatable and rapid flowing fountain'. It is the name of a fountain of heaven.
data.sentence: The word السَّبِيلَا comes from the root س ب ل and is associated with the meanings: cause, reason, way/path/road, necessity, means of access, responsibility, method/manner, plea to allege.. fi sabil Allah - in the way of Allah, in the cause of Allah, to carry the message of Allah.. ibn al-sabil - traveller, way farer, forlorn traveller.. salsabil - It is made up of two words: sal (ask, enquire about) & sabil (way), salsala - easy, sweet, rapid flowing water. As if it meant 'Inquiring ask your Lord the way to that sweet, easy palatable and rapid flowing fountain'. It is the name of a fountain of heaven.
